appeals.sector: Country cluster for Sierra Leone, Liberia, Guinea and Guinea Bisau

field_reports.description:
In the morning hours of Monday 18 December 2023, a major explosion occurred at Guinea's primary oil terminal situated in the Kaloum administrative district of Conakry, blowing out the windows of several nearby homes and forcing hundreds to flee.  The incident led to a massive fire and the release of dense black smoke, visible from a considerable distance. Swiftly, firefighters arrived at the scene, while several tanker trucks departed from the depot, escorted by soldiers and police for protection. Even after the firefighters successfully brought the fire under control later in the day, a thick column of smoke and some flames remained visible. It is worth noting that Guinea does not produce oil and lacks oil refining capabilities. Instead, it relies on importing refined products, which are primarily stored in the Kaloum terminal and distributed throughout the country via trucks.

The current extent of the damage sustained by the terminal remains uncertain at this moment. However, this unfortunate incident has resulted in the loss of both lives and properties. The initial report on human casualties indicates that there are at least 12 fatalities, 131 individuals injured, and several people still missing. The injured have been promptly evacuated to Donka and Ignace Deen hospitals, while the deceased have been transported to the respective morgues. The current situation does not provide a definite count of the displaced individuals and the overall number of affected people. Nevertheless, the ongoing process of registration and assessment will offer a comprehensive understanding of the extent of the damage and the number of individuals requiring assistance. This information will be provided in SitRep#2, which will be issued subsequent to a scheduled meeting with the Guinea Red Cross on the morning of Tuesday, December 19, 2023.

The government has issued a statement acknowledging that the cause of the fire is currently unknown. They have also announced the initiation of an investigation to determine the origin and any potential causes of the fire. The government expressed deep concern and emphasized the significant impact this incident could have on the population. The Command Post situated at the Ministry of Defense serves as the central hub for the Minister of Security to coordinate the state's response efforts. The Minister has given assurance that the fire is presently being brought under control and extinguished. As the situation is being brought under control, the government has advised citizens to stay at home. Furthermore, the following measures were put into effect on Monday, December 18, 2023...

Ø  Workers in the public and private sectors, except the defense and security forces and the medical profession, are requested to stay at home 

Ø  Public and private schools closed 

Ø  Gas stations closed, except for emergency services.

appeals.sector: Country cluster for Sierra Leone, Liberia, Guinea and Guinea Bisau

field_reports.description:
August has recorded significant heavy rains across Guinea, affecting several prefectures of the country. In the morning hours of August 6, 2023, heavy rain in the prefecture of Coyah and its surroundings overflowed the Sarinka River, resulting in flooding in the Urban and Rural Communities of Maneah and Kouriah, affecting nine localities: Fily, Tougandé,  Batouyah, and Sambaya in the urban communities; Tanènè and Tanènè2 in the Rural Commune of Kouria, and Boguitagui, Bangouyah, and Kouria center in the Rural Commune of Kouria, destroying several homes and washing away properties of affected families. During evacuation and rescue, some women, children, and the elderly were identified to be ill that require urgent medical support, while others were trapped in their houses, and some sitting on the roof of their houses requesting rescue. Flooding has also been reported in other locations due to continuous downpours of rains. Faced with this situation, an emergency team was deployed comprising the Minister of Territorial Administration and Decentralization, the Director General of ANGUCH, the Regional Director of Civil Protection, the Red Cross and the Environment as well as medical teams and gendarmerie and police units.

The initial assessments provided by the Guinea Red Cross indicate floods reportedly killed three people, leaving 933 more injured. In this locality of Coyah with 281,757 inhabitants and 40,251 households, a total of 5,115 families amounting to 35,809 people have been reported to be displaced. This same rainfall caused a landslide in the urban community of Kindia causing the fall of a tree from the top of a valley on a dwelling house leaving people injured. The technical services of the National Agency for Emergency Management and Humanitarian Disasters, the Guinea Red Cross, and the environment continue to assess the damage on the ground.

The coping capacities of affected households have already been stretched considering the floods have washed away all household items including reserved food, added to the economic crisis that has been impacting the country. While the situation remained fluid, the additional impact of flooding implies that vulnerabilities continue to increase as the capacity to cope decreases.

The Guinea Meteorological Department is forecasting more heavy rain for several prefectures that might result in floods, especially in flood-prone communities, and areas close to rivers where overflow is likely. The incessant flooding in these locations, coupled with the fact that affected people are currently without support calls for urgent efforts to address immediate humanitarian needs. The mayor, who is the political head of the Coyah prefecture has called for immediate support from humanitarian organizations and well-wishers.

field_reports.epi_notes_since_last_fr: Two laboratory tests have been conducted on the sample; at the virology center in Conakry, the sample was confirmed positive. Also, at the Virology Laboratory of the Institute Pasteur in Dakar / Senegal, the sample was confirmed to be positive. An outbreak of yellow fever has been declared by the government.
field_reports.description: On Monday, January 16, 2023, a suspected case of yellow fever was reported in the village of Konsondou, sub-District of Bissikrima, District of Dabola. The patient was received for fever, headache, vomiting, and jaundice. In the history of the disease, the parents thought of simple malaria by self-medicating based on initial symptoms. Given the persistence of these symptoms, the parent was taken to consult the prefectural hospital of Dabola for better care. From observed symptoms and high fever, a sample was taken from this patient and sent to the virology center in Conakry for examination. Following laboratory investigation, it was confirmed to be a positive yellow fever case. A second test was carried out on the sample sent to the Virology Laboratory of the Institute Pasteur in Dakar / Senegal was also positive, thus confirming yellow fever. The Government through the ministry of health on Tuesday, January 17, 2023, declared a yellow fever outbreak in Dabola district of Guinea. At the epidemiological level, there is no notification of travel outside the prefecture according to the parents.

results.name: GIN: Epidemic - 2023-01 - Yellow Fever
results.summary: On Monday, January 16, 2023, a suspected case of yellow fever was reported in the village of Konsondou, sub-District of Bissikrima, District of Dabola. results.name: Guinea: 2022 Kankan floods
results.summary:
From 25 and 26 August 2022, Guinea experienced substantial¬†and uninterrupted rainfall throughout the entire country,¬†resulting in severe flooding in multiple prefectures. The Red¬†Cross Society of Guinea (RCSG) and National Disaster¬†Management Agency conducted an assessment and¬†determined that the impact was felt in 13 out of the 27 districts¬†of the Kankan province, and 7 out of the 12 sub-prefectures.¬†Approximately 29,000 people were affected by the flooding,¬†with 24,135 people (3,448 households) classified as the most¬†severely affected. This includes 10,839 men and 13,296¬†women.

In response to the floods in August 2022, a Disaster Relief Emergency Fund (DREF) was allocated to address the needs¬†of 18,844 individuals (2,708 households) among the most affected population. This decision was made collaboratively¬†with key stakeholders, taking into account agreed-upon prioritization criteria.

field_reports.description:
Following continuous heavy rains between 29th - 30th July 2024 the city of Siguiri causing flooding in 14 neighborhoods (BTN, Bolibana, Sigurikoura, Nankoda, Kokomo, Heremakonon, Chinese City, Tiguibiry, Konoba, Abatoire, Setceur TP, Téléladji, ORS1 and Mandén sector) and 4 Sub-Prefectures: Kintinian (Kintian Centre, Boukaria, Balata and Kofilanin), Djomabanan (Djomanan Centre and Karakoro), Kinièbakoura (Kinièbakoura Centre); Niandankoro (Niandankoro center and Damissakoro).

The Prefectural Committee of the Red Cross of Siguiri in collaboration with the local authorities (Chiefs of neighborhoods and mayors of rural communes) immediately deployed (50) volunteers and 50 supervisors for first aid and evacuation of victims. The flooding has affected an estimated total of 19195 people (3839 HHs) comprising men, women, Children aged 0-5 years, people with disability, and the Elderly.

field_reports.description:
La Gouvernement Guin√©en vient d‚Äôenregistrer un cas mortel de fi√®vre Lassa dans pr√©fecture de Yomou, au courant du mois de Mai 2021, pendant qu‚Äôil est en train de d√©ployer des efforts louables pour la double riposte √† la pand√©mie de la COVID-19 et √† l‚Äô√©pid√©mie d‚ÄôEbola.
L‚Äô√©chantillon pr√©lev√© sur le cas index d√©c√©d√© est positif √† la fi√®vre lassa apr√®s une double confirmation par les laboratoires de N‚ÄôZ√©r√©kor√© et celui des fi√®vres h√©morragiques de Conakry.
Une investigation est en cours dans les villages concern√©s, et √† ce jour 30 contacts sont identifi√©s et suivis.
Au regard de cette situation et en application du r√®glement sanitaire International (RSI), le Ministre de la Sant√© d√©clare l‚ÄôEpid√©mie de Fi√®vre Lassa dans la pr√©fecture de Yomou, r√©gion de N‚ÄôZ√©r√©kor√©.
Face √† cette urgence, le minist√®re de la sant√© a pris les dispositions urgentes √† savoir :
-          La sensibilisation des populations   et des services de sant√© sur les mesures universelles de pr√©vention et de contr√¥le des infections
-          Le renforcement de la surveillance √©pid√©miologique et
-      La prise en charge des cas suspects avec la Ribavirine dans les structures de Sant√© identifi√©es √† cet effet.
A noter que la Croix-Rouge √† travers son comit√© pr√©fectoral de Gueck√©dou a notifi√© deux cas de d√©c√®s et deux cas de maladies dans la sous-pr√©fecture de Guendembou, district de Badala le 18 mai 2021. Cette information a √©t√© partag√©e avec l‚ÄôANSS et les autorit√©s sanitaires de Gueck√©dou ont aussit√¥t d√©ploy√©s une √©quipe d‚Äôinvestigation et des pr√©l√®vements ont √©t√© effectu√©s. Nous sommes en attente des r√©sultats de ces pr√©l√®vements.
Au regard de tout ce qui pr√©c√®de, le gouvernement a lanc√© un appel √† la communaut√© nationale et aux partenaires internationaux de bien vouloir apporter leur assistance afin de circonscrire l‚Äô√©volution de cette √©pid√©mie.

appeals.sector: Africa Regional Office and Country cluster for Kenya and Somalia

field_reports.description: The Ministry of Health health authorities have √©t√©ÃÅ informed N'Z√©r√©kor√© Prefectural Health Directorate of the detection of suspected cases of Ebola with symptoms of diarrhea, vomiting, and bleeding in people who participated in the burial of a nurse at the Gouek√© health center. The nurse died on January 28, 2021 and her funeral took place on February 1 in Gouek√©. The first investigation carried out counted 7 cases, all over 25 years of age (4 men and 3 women) including 3 cases of death (2 women and 1 man). All cases participated in the nurse's funeral. The first three samples sent to the laboratories in Gueckedou and Conakry proved to be POSITIVE in Ebola. Faced with this situation and in application of the International Health Regulations (IHR), the Guinean government declared an outbreak of Ebola disease in the N'Z√©r√©kor√© sub-prefecture of Goueck√©. A crisis meeting held on February 14, 2021 under the chairmanship of the Minister of Health, in the presence of technical and financial, international and national partners including the Red Cross, at the ANSS recommended the following measures: - Isolation of all suspect cases at the CTEPI in N'Z√©r√©kor√© and Conakry; - Investigation of the cases to clarify the data, identify other suspect cases and identify all contacts to be isolated; - Dispatch of an emergency investigation mission from the central level to support the local teams in Goueck√©; - Activation of the coordination and technical commissions of the Ebola response; - Activation of intersectoral coordination through the One Health platform; - Supply of inputs for awareness, prevention, diagnosis and care; - Opening of a center for the management of cases detected in Goueck√©; - Acceleration of the acquisition of Ebola vaccines from the WHO; - Implementation of standard IHR procedures. The N'zerekor√© prefecture, located 954 km from the capital of Guinea, is the capital of the prefecture and the capital of the forest region. This region is composed of the prefectures of : Yomou, Beyla, Lola, Macenta, Gueckedou and N'zerekor√©. It is in this region that the first wave of EBOLA epidemic was declared and remained for more than 2 years with material and human damage. It should be noted that since the end of the declaration of the epidemic of EBOLA in Guinea in 2016 the prefecture of N'z√©r√©kor√© had not yet notified any case Gou√©ck√© is one of the ten sub-prefectures that make up the prefecture of N'Z√©r√©kor√©. It is located 42 KM from central N'z√©r√©kor√© with a total population of about 23545 inhabitants for 3364 households. It is in this locality that we recorded two (02) probable deaths, one (01) confirmed death, one (01) under analysis and two (02) confirmed live cases hospitalized at the CTEPI, and one (02) transferred suspect patient. During this morning's meeting, the ANSS (the national health security agency) in charge of managing epidemics in Guinea proceeded to set up working commissions for the fight against this epidemic. The CRG is represented in the commissions of : Care, Surveillance, Logistics, Communication and Social Mobilization. The Red Cross Prefectural Committee is already active and operational in N'z√©r√©kor√©, it has managed 2 bodies in N'z√©r√©kor√© and disinfected the regional hospital in N'z√©r√©kor√©.

results.name: West Africa : Ebola Outbreak
results.summary:
The first confirmed case of EVD was reported in Guinea on 14 February 2021, with the origins of the outbreak unknown, and probable cases dating back to at least January. Six of the first seven known cases (17 as of 28 February 2021) were reportedly within the same family who attended the burial ceremony of a nurse from Gou√©ck√© health centre. The nurse died on 28 January 2021 and was buried on 1 February 2021. Of the seven cases, four are men and three are women (aged 25 and over), with three deaths (2 women and 1 man).

The outbreak is currently centred in Gou√©ck√© community in the N'Z√©r√©kor√© prefecture in Guin√©e Forresti√®re Region. Gou√©ck√© is one of ten subprefectures that make up N'Z√©r√©kor√© prefecture. It is located 42 kilometres from central N'Z√©r√©kor√© with a total population of approximately 23,458 inhabitants in 3,364 households. The Ministry of Health authorities were informed by the N'Z√©r√©kor√© Prefectural Health Directorate that they had detected suspected cases of Ebola with symptoms consisting of diarrhea, vomiting, and bleeding in people who participated in the burial of a nurse at the Gouek√© health centre.

On the 20th of February 2021 the IFRC launched and Emergency appeal seeking CHF8.5 million on a preliminary basis to deliver assistance to some 424,000 people in the affected area for 12 months.

The funding will enable the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) to support the National Societies of Guinea, to scale-up readiness and response to the ongoing epidemic; Cote D¬¥Ivoire, Liberia and Sierra Leone, to set-up advanced readiness and preparedness; and Senegal and Mali, to reinforce readiness capacity through light preparedness and prepositioning of stocks.

field_reports.description:
Dans ces cinq derni√®res ann√©es on constate un surpeuplement et une construction de plus en plus anarchique dans les quartiers de la commune urbaine. Notamment : inexistence des canaux d‚Äô√©vacuation, les m√©canismes de gestion efficace des ordures, construction dans les basfonds inondables et aux bords des fleuves. Egalement le fleuve Milo traverse la commune urbaine. La combinaison de ces facteurs et la grande pluviom√©trie de cette ann√©e ont occasionn√© des inondations.
Du 6 au 7 septembre 2020, 26 sur les 27 quartiers de la commune urbaine et 12 sous-pr√©fectures de Kankan ont connu une forte pluie causant des d√©g√¢ts majeurs aux personnes.
Suite √† cette inondation le comit√© pr√©fectoral de la Croix-Rouge de Kankan √† travers ces Equipes Communautaires de R√©ponse aux Catastrophes (NDRT/CDRT) coordonn√©e par les membres de l‚ÄôEquipe Nationale de R√©ponse aux Catastrophes (NDRT/CDRT) avec l‚Äôaccord des autorit√©s pr√©fectorales, sous pr√©fectorales, communales et celles des quartiers, le comit√© a d√©ploy√© 50 volontaires et 5 Superviseurs qui ont men√© les √©valuations dans ces diff√©rentes localit√©s.
Les r√©sultats de l‚Äô√©valuation sont les suivants, 9907 m√©nages affect√©s, 49536 personnes affect√©s dont 23 248 hommes et 26 288 femmes, 4 371 enfants de 0 √† 5 ans, 1145 femmes enceintes, 1238 femmes allaitantes, 135 personnes handicap√©es, 946 personnes √¢g√©es, 3975 enfants dormant sous moustiquaires, 1101 femmes enceintes dormant sous moustiquaires, 47 cas de diarrh√©es, 12 bless√©s, 657 maisons d√©truites, 1363 personnes d√©plac√©es, 551 points d‚Äôeau d√©truits, 75 familles d‚Äôaccueil, 744 latrines d√©truites. Il y a √©galement, des impacts √©normes sur l‚Äôagriculture et l‚Äô√©levage.
Ces victimes et les autorit√©s sollicitent l‚Äôappui des personnes de bonnes volont√©s et des organisations humanitaires pour se relever des maux dont elles souffrent actuellement.
